intro: Henriettella granularis, commonly known as the granular henriettella, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean region. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. Henriettella granularis thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas. It plays an important role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small insects.
